definition: double/twice/simultaneous/holding two or more (official) posts at the same time

sentences.english: The repairman apologized and threwthe bike in the back of his truck.
sentences.chinese: 修理工到了歉，把自行車放到卡車後面。

sentences.english: Later I apologized to Hooper for his reception.
sentences.chinese: 後來爲了他受到的待遇我向胡珀道了歉。

sentences.english: Dimitri apologized to Aleko for having accused him.
sentences.chinese: 向阿列科道了歉，說是錯怪了他。

sentences.english: Return the money to Jim and make an apology. I think he will forgive you.
sentences.chinese: 把錢還給吉姆，道個歉，我想他會原諒你的。

sentences.english: Ms. Wang said that the captain did not wait for an apology to passengers, then said.
sentences.chinese: 王女士說，這期間沒有等到機長向乘客們說道歉的話。

sentences.english: The offender apologized when he sobered up.
The prisoner's resistance weakened after seven days.
sentences.chinese: 勰歉牢犯的抵抗七天後變弱了。

sentences.english: You apologize to him and give him a step to avoid embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 你就道個歉，給他個臺階下吧。

sentences.english: At first he refused to accept any responsibility but he ended up apologizing.
sentences.chinese: 最初他拒不承認有任何責任，到頭來還是道了歉。

sentences.english: He apologized for their reckless behavior.
sentences.chinese: 他對他們的魯莽行爲道了歉。

sentences.english: His regrets was stuttering to me.
sentences.chinese: 他結結巴巴地向我道了歉。

sentences.english: Tom:Return the money to Jim and make an apology. I think he will forgive you.
sentences.chinese: 把錢還給吉姆，道個歉，我想他會原諒你的。

sentences.english: Dish to he apologized and farming discovered wheel exercise books.
sentences.chinese: 道向他道了歉，農發現了車輪下的作業本。

sentences.english: It's all  sewn up, since you apologized.
sentences.chinese: 既然你已經道了歉，這件事就算了。

sentences.english: As for Xu Yang, he eventually apologized to his mother.
sentences.chinese: 最後，徐陽還是向母親道了歉。

sentences.english: Farming for misunderstanding things apologized, way is not concerned.
sentences.chinese: 農爲誤會的事情道了歉，道並不在意。

definition: to offer an apology/to make amends
to know that one is in the wrong (idiom)
to admit an error/to acknowledge one's mistake
to bow respectfully with clasped hands/to beg humbly
slip of the tongue/indiscretion/to blurt out a secret
